title: Deacon Stephanos at the Diaconia
description: The deacon who gives you bread for the widow

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (The diaconia is busy—people coming and going, sacks of grain being moved, the smell of baking bread.)

lines.speaker: Stephanos
lines.text: (A young man in deacon's vestments approaches.) Another one for the bread line?

lines.speaker: Stephanos
lines.text: (He looks you over.) No, wait. You don't have that look. Who are you?

choices.text: Chrysostom sent me. I need bread for the widow Maria.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: The Archbishop himself? (His posture changes—more respect.) What's your name?

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: I haven't seen you before. Are you new to the city?

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: Hm. The Archbishop has an eye for... unusual helpers. (He smiles.)

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: Wait here. Maria in the eastern quarter, you said?

chrysostom_sent.speaker: You
chrysostom_sent.text: Yes. Her husband died at the harbor.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: (His face darkens.) Theodoros. I knew him. Good man. The shipowner should have paid his family.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: But the rich look after themselves first. Always.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: (He goes into a back room and returns with a bundle—bread, cheese, dried figs.)

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: For Maria and the children. And here—(he adds a smaller bundle)—this is for you.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: You don't have to ask. The Church sees those who serve. You're doing God's work today.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: Stephanos
chrysostom_sent.text: Chrysostom says the hands that give are holier than the lips that pray. I believe him.

chrysostom_sent.speaker: System
chrysostom_sent.text: ✦ You received bread for Maria and food for yourself. ✦

chrysostom_sent.speaker: System
chrysostom_sent.text: Find Maria in the eastern quarter.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: Work? We always need hands. Can you carry? Sweep? Count?

looking_for_work.speaker: You
looking_for_work.text: I can do all of those.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: Good. The diaconia feeds hundreds every day. There's bread to bake, grain to measure, lines to manage.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: The pay isn't much—we're not merchants. But you'll eat, and you'll have a roof some nights.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: More than that... you'll see what the Church does. Not just talk—action.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: Chrysostom says we should give until it hurts. Then give more.

looking_for_work.speaker: Stephanos
looking_for_work.text: Come back tomorrow at dawn if you want to help. We can use you.

looking_for_work.speaker: System
looking_for_work.text: ✦ You can work at the diaconia for food and shelter. ✦

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: This? This is the diaconia—the Church's hands in Constantinople.

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: When Christ said 'feed the hungry,' He didn't mean 'think about it.' He meant do it.

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: So we do it. Every day. Bread for the poor, shelter for the homeless, care for the sick.

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: Chrysostom reorganized everything when he became Archbishop. Before him, the Church was... comfortable.

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: (He lowers his voice.) Some of the clergy didn't like it. They preferred their gold plates.

what_is_this.speaker: Stephanos
what_is_this.text: The Archbishop sold the gold plates. Bought bread instead.

what_is_this.speaker: You
what_is_this.text: (You look around at the organized chaos—poor people being fed, children receiving bread.)

what_is_this.speaker: You
what_is_this.text: (This is what Chrysostom meant. Not words. Action.)

choices.text: Actually, Chrysostom sent me. I need bread for Maria.

leave.speaker: Stephanos
leave.text: God go with you. And if you're ever hungry, come here. We don't ask questions.
